00217 /******************************************************************************/
00218 /* bit hacks */
00219 
00220 #if defined(_MSC_VER) && !defined(__cplusplus)
00221 #include <intrin.h>
00222 #pragma intrinsic(_BitScanReverse)
00223 #endif
00224 
00229 #define TOMMY_ILOG2(value) ((value) == 256 ? 8 : (value) == 128 ? 7 :(value) == 64 ? 6 : (value) == 32 ? 5 : (value) == 16 ? 4 : (value) == 8 ? 3 : (value) == 4 ? 2 : (value) == 2 ? 1 : 0)
00230 
00249 tommy_inline unsigned tommy_ilog2_u32(tommy_uint32_t value)
00250 {
00251 #if defined(_MSC_VER)
00252         unsigned long count;
00253         _BitScanReverse(&count, value);
00254         return count;
00255 #elif defined(__GNUC__)
00256         /*
00257          * GCC implements __builtin_clz(x) as "__builtin_clz(x) = bsr(x) ^ 31"
00258          *
00259          * Where "x ^ 31 = 31 - x", but gcc does not optimize "31 - __builtin_clz(x)" to bsr(x),
00260          * but generates 31 - (bsr(x) xor 31).
00261          *
00262          * So we write "__builtin_clz(x) ^ 31" instead of "31 - __builtin_clz(x)".
00263          */
00264         return __builtin_clz(value) ^ 31;
00265 #else
00266         /* Find the log base 2 of an N-bit integer in O(lg(N)) operations with multiply and lookup */
00267         /* from http://graphics.stanford.edu/~seander/bithacks.html */
00268         static const int TOMMY_DE_BRUIJN_INDEX_ILOG2[32] = {
00269                 0, 9, 1, 10, 13, 21, 2, 29, 11, 14, 16, 18, 22, 25, 3, 30,
00270                 8, 12, 20, 28, 15, 17, 24, 7, 19, 27, 23, 6, 26, 5, 4, 31
00271         };
00272 
00273         value |= value >> 1;
00274         value |= value >> 2;
00275         value |= value >> 4;
00276         value |= value >> 8;
00277         value |= value >> 16;
00278 
00279         return TOMMY_DE_BRUIJN_INDEX_ILOG2[(tommy_uint32_t)(value * 0x07C4ACDDU) >> 27];
00280 #endif
00281 }
00282 
00291 tommy_inline unsigned tommy_ctz_u32(tommy_uint32_t value)
00292 {
00293 #if defined(_MSC_VER)
00294         unsigned long count;
00295         _BitScanForward(&count, value);
00296         return count;
00297 #elif defined(__GNUC__)
00298         return __builtin_ctz(value);
00299 #else
00300         /* Count the consecutive zero bits (trailing) on the right with multiply and lookup */
00301         /* from http://graphics.stanford.edu/~seander/bithacks.html */
00302         static const tommy_uint32_t TOMMY_DE_BRUIJN_INDEX_CTZ[32] = {
00303                 0, 1, 28, 2, 29, 14, 24, 3, 30, 22, 20, 15, 25, 17, 4, 8,
00304                 31, 27, 13, 23, 21, 19, 16, 7, 26, 12, 18, 6, 11, 5, 10, 9
00305         };
00306 
00307         return TOMMY_DE_BRUIJN_INDEX_CTZ[(tommy_uint32_t)(((value & -value) * 0x077CB531U)) >> 27];
00308 #endif
00309 }
00310 
00316 tommy_inline tommy_uint32_t tommy_roundup_pow2_u32(tommy_uint32_t value)
00317 {
00318         /* Round up to the next highest power of 2 */
00319         /* from http://www-graphics.stanford.edu/~seander/bithacks.html */
00320 
00321         --value;
00322         value |= value >> 1;
00323         value |= value >> 2;
00324         value |= value >> 4;
00325         value |= value >> 8;
00326         value |= value >> 16;
00327         ++value;
00328 
00329         return value;
00330 }
00331 #endif
